 269      /**
 270       * Constructor
 271       *
 272       * @param object table Database row
 273       * @param string
 274       * @param string
 275       * @param string
 276       * @param string for derived classes
 277       * @param string datetime field name
 278       * @param string datetime field name
 279       * @param string User ID field name
 280       * @param string User ID field name
 281       */
 282  	function Item( $db_row = NULL, $dbtable = 'T_items__item', $dbprefix = 'post_', $dbIDname = 'post_ID', $objtype = 'Item',
 283                     $datecreated_field = 'datecreated', $datemodified_field = 'datemodified',
 284                     $creator_field = 'creator_user_ID', $lasteditor_field = 'lastedit_user_ID' )
 285      {
 286          global $localtimenow, $default_locale, $current_User;
 287  
 288          // Call parent constructor:
 289          parent::ItemLight( $db_row, $dbtable, $dbprefix, $dbIDname, $objtype,
 290                     $datecreated_field, $datemodified_field,
 291                     $creator_field, $lasteditor_field );
 292  
 293          if( is_null($db_row) )
 294          { // New item:
 295              if( isset($current_User) )
 296              { // use current user as default, if available (which won't be the case during install)
 297                  $this->creator_user_login = $current_User->login;
 298                  $this->set_creator_User( $current_User );
 299              }
 300              $this->set( 'dateset', 0 );    // Date not explicitly set yet
 301              $this->set( 'notifications_status', 'noreq' );
 302              // Set the renderer list to 'default' will trigger all 'opt-out' renderers:
 303              $this->set( 'renderers', array('default') );
 304              // we prolluy don't need this: $this->set( 'status', 'published' );
 305              $this->set( 'locale', $default_locale );
 306              $this->set( 'priority', 3 );
 307              $this->set( 'ptyp_ID', 1 /* Post */ );
 308          }
 309          else
 310          {
 311              $this->datecreated = $db_row->post_datecreated;                     // When Item was created in the system
 312              $this->last_touched_ts = $db_row->post_last_touched_ts;        // When Item received last visible change (edit, comment, etc.)
 313              $this->creator_user_ID = $db_row->post_creator_user_ID;     // Needed for history display
 314              $this->lastedit_user_ID = $db_row->post_lastedit_user_ID; // Needed for history display
 315              $this->assigned_user_ID = $db_row->post_assigned_user_ID;
 316              $this->dateset = $db_row->post_dateset;
 317              $this->status = $db_row->post_status;
 318              $this->content = $db_row->post_content;
 319              $this->titletag = $db_row->post_titletag;
 320              $this->pst_ID = $db_row->post_pst_ID;
 321              $this->datedeadline = $db_row->post_datedeadline;
 322              $this->priority = $db_row->post_priority;
 323              $this->locale = $db_row->post_locale;
 324              $this->wordcount = $db_row->post_wordcount;
 325              $this->notifications_status = $db_row->post_notifications_status;
 326              $this->notifications_ctsk_ID = $db_row->post_notifications_ctsk_ID;
 327              $this->comment_status = $db_row->post_comment_status;            // Comments status
 328              $this->order = $db_row->post_order;
 329              $this->featured = $db_row->post_featured;
 330  
 331              // echo 'renderers=', $db_row->post_renderers;
 332              $this->renderers = $db_row->post_renderers;
 333  
 334              $this->excerpt = $db_row->post_excerpt;
 335              $this->excerpt_autogenerated = $db_row->post_excerpt_autogenerated;
 336  
 337              // Location
 338  
 339              if ( ! empty ( $db_row->post_ctry_ID ) )
 340              {
 341                  $this->ctry_ID = $db_row->post_ctry_ID;
 342              }
 343  
 344              if ( ! empty ( $db_row->post_rgn_ID ) )
 345              {
 346                  $this->rgn_ID = $db_row->post_rgn_ID;
 347              }
 348  
 349              if ( ! empty ( $db_row->post_subrg_ID ) )
 350              {
 351                  $this->subrg_ID = $db_row->post_subrg_ID;
 352              }
 353  
 354              if ( ! empty ( $db_row->post_city_ID ) )
 355              {
 356                  $this->city_ID = $db_row->post_city_ID;
 357              }
 358  
 359          }
 360  
 361          modules_call_method( 'constructor_item', array( 'Item' => & $this ) );
 362      }

 365      /**
 366       * Set creator user
 367       *
 368       * @param string login
 369       */
 370  	function set_creator_by_login( $login )
 371      {
 372          $UserCache = & get_UserCache();
 373          if( ( $creator_User = &$UserCache->get_by_login( $login ) ) !== false )
 374          {
 375              $this->set( $this->creator_field, $creator_User->ID );
 376          }
 377      }
 378  
 379  
 380      /**
 381       * Assign user to the item by user ID or by user login
 382       *
 383       * @todo use extended dbchange instead of set_param...
 384       * @todo Normalize to set_assigned_User!?
 385       *
 386       * @param integer User ID
 387       * @param string User login
 388       * @param boolean TRUE to update DB
 389       * @return boolean TRUE on success, FALSE if user cannot be assigned on this item
 390       */
 391  	function assign_to( $user_ID, $user_login = '', $dbupdate = true /* BLOAT!? */ )
 392      {
 393          global $Messages;
 394  
 395          if( ! empty( $user_ID ) )
 396          { // Get an user by ID to check perms
 397              $UserCache = & get_UserCache();
 398              $assigned_User = & $UserCache->get_by_ID( $user_ID, false, false );
 399          }
 400          else if( ! empty( $user_login ) )
 401          { // If an assigned user ID is empty find it by user login
 402              $UserCache = & get_UserCache();
 403              $assigned_User = & $UserCache->get_by_login( $user_login );
 404              if( empty( $assigned_User ) )
 405              { // Invalid user login was entered
 406                  $Messages->add( sprintf( T_('User %s doesn\'t exist!'), '<b>'.$user_login.'</b>' ), 'error' );
 407                  return false;
 408              }
 409          }
 410  
 411          if( ! empty( $assigned_User ) )
 412          { // Check if the selected user can be assigned to this item
 413              $this->load_Blog();
 414              if( $assigned_User->check_perm( 'blog_can_be_assignee', 'view', false, $this->Blog->ID ) )
 415              { // User exists and has permission to be assigned user to items of the blog
 416                  $user_ID = $assigned_User->ID;
 417              }
 418              else
 419              { // No permission to be assigned
 420                  $Messages->add( sprintf( T_('User %s cannot be assigned to the items of this blog!'), '<b>'.$assigned_User->login.'</b>' ), 'error' );
 421                  return false;
 422              }
 423          }
 424  
 425          if( ! empty( $user_ID ) )
 426          {
 427              if( $dbupdate )
 428              { // Record ID for DB:
 429                  $this->set_param( 'assigned_user_ID', 'number', $user_ID, true );
 430              }
 431              else
 432              {
 433                  $this->assigned_user_ID = $user_ID;
 434              }
 435              $UserCache = & get_UserCache();
 436              $this->assigned_User = & $UserCache->get_by_ID( $user_ID );
 437          }
 438          else
 439          {
 440              // fp>> DO NOT set (to null) immediately OR it may KILL the current User object (big problem if it's the Current User)
 441              unset( $this->assigned_User );
 442              if( $dbupdate )
 443              { // Record ID for DB:
 444                  $this->set_param( 'assigned_user_ID', 'number', NULL, true );
 445              }
 446              else
 447              {
 448                  $this->assigned_User = NULL;
 449              }
 450              $this->assigned_user_ID = NULL;
 451          }
 452  
 453          return true;
 454      }

 457      /**
 458       * Template function: display author/creator of item
 459       *
 460       */
 461  	function author( $params = array() )
 462      {
 463          // Make sure we are not missing any param:
 464          $params = array_merge( array(
 465                  'before'         => ' ',
 466                  'after'          => ' ',
 467                  'link_text'      => 'preferredname', // avatar | only_avatar | login | nickname | firstname | lastname | fullname | preferredname
 468                  'thumb_size'     => 'crop-top-32x32',
 469                  'thumb_class'    => '',
 470                  'thumb_zoomable' => false,
 471                  'login_mask'     => '', // example: 'text $login$ text'
 472                  'display_bubbletip' => true,
 473                  'nowrap'         => true,
 474              ), $params );
 475  
 476          // Load User
 477          $this->get_creator_User();
 478  
 479          $r = $this->creator_User->get_identity_link( $params );
 480  
 481          echo $params['before'].$r.$params['after'];
 482      }
 483

 485      /**
 486       * Template function: display user who edited the item last time
 487       *
 488       */
 489  	function lastedit_user( $params = array() )
 490      {
 491          // Make sure we are not missing any param:
 492          $params = array_merge( array(
 493                  'profile_tab'    => 'user',
 494                  'before'         => ' ',
 495                  'after'          => ' ',
 496                  'format'         => 'htmlbody',
 497                  'link_to'        => 'userpage',
 498                  'link_text'      => 'preferredname', // avatar | only_avatar | login | nickname | firstname | lastname | fullname | preferredname
 499                  'link_rel'       => '',
 500                  'link_class'     => '',
 501                  'thumb_size'     => 'crop-top-32x32',
 502                  'thumb_class'    => '',
 503                  'thumb_zoomable' => false,
 504              ), $params );
 505  
 506          // Load User
 507          $this->get_lastedit_User();
 508  
 509          if( $this->lastedit_User )
 510          {    // Get a link to user profile page
 511              $r = $this->lastedit_User->get_identity_link( $params );
 512          }
 513          else
 514          {    // User was deleted
 515              $r = T_('(deleted user)');
 516          }
 517  
 518          echo $params['before'].$r.$params['after'];
 519      }

 521  
 522      /**
 523       * Load data from Request form fields.
 524       *
 525       * This requires the blog (e.g. {@link $blog_ID} or {@link $main_cat_ID} to be set).
 526       *
 527       * @param boolean true if we are returning to edit mode (new, switchtab...)
 528       * @return boolean true if loaded data seems valid.
 529       */
 530  	function load_from_Request( $editing = false, $creating = false )
 531      {
 532          global $default_locale, $current_User, $localtimenow;
 533          global $posttypes_reserved_IDs, $item_typ_ID;
 534  
 535          // LOCALE:
 536          if( param( 'post_locale', 'string', NULL ) !== NULL )
 537          {
 538              $this->set_from_Request( 'locale' );
 539          }
 540  
 541          // TYPE:
 542          if( param( 'post_type', 'string', NULL ) !== NULL )
 543          { // Set type ID from request type code, happens when e.g. we add an intro from manual skin by url: /blog6.php?disp=edit&cat=25&post_type=intro-cat
 544              $this->set( 'ptyp_ID', get_item_type_ID( get_param( 'post_type' ) ) );
 545          }
 546          elseif( param( 'item_typ_ID', 'integer', NULL ) !== NULL )
 547          { // fp> when does this happen?
 548              // yura>fp: this happens on submit expert form
 549              $this->set_from_Request( 'ptyp_ID', 'item_typ_ID' );
 550  
 551              if( in_array( $item_typ_ID, $posttypes_reserved_IDs ) )
 552              {
 553                  param_error( 'item_typ_ID', T_( 'This post type is reserved and cannot be used. Please choose another one.' ), '' );
 554              }
 555          }
 556  
 557          // URL associated with Item:
 558          if( param( 'post_url', 'string', NULL ) !== NULL )
 559          {
 560              param_check_url( 'post_url', 'posting', '' );
 561              $this->set_from_Request( 'url' );
 562          }
 563  
 564          if( $this->status == 'redirected' && empty($this->url) )
 565          {
 566              // Note: post_url is not part of the simple form, so this message can be a little bit awkward there
 567              param_error( 'post_url', T_('If you want to redirect this post, you must specify an URL! (Expert mode)') );
 568          }
 569  
 570          // ISSUE DATE / TIMESTAMP:
 571          $this->load_Blog();
 572          if( $current_User->check_perm( 'blog_edit_ts', 'edit', false, $this->Blog->ID ) )
 573          {
 574              $this->set( 'dateset', param( 'item_dateset', 'integer', 0 ) );
 575  
 576              if( $editing || $this->dateset == 1 )
 577              { // We can use user date:
 578                  if( param_date( 'item_issue_date', T_('Please enter a valid issue date.'), true )
 579                      && param_time( 'item_issue_time' ) )
 580                  { // only set it, if a (valid) date and time was given:
 581                      $this->set( 'issue_date', form_date( get_param( 'item_issue_date' ), get_param( 'item_issue_time' ) ) ); // TODO: cleanup...
 582                  }
 583              }
 584              elseif( $this->dateset == 0 )
 585              {    // Set date to NOW:
 586                  $this->set( 'issue_date', date('Y-m-d H:i:s', $localtimenow) );
 587              }
 588          }
 589  
 590          // DEADLINE:
 591          if( param_date( 'item_deadline', T_('Please enter a valid deadline.'), false, NULL ) !== NULL ) {
 592              $this->set_from_Request( 'datedeadline', 'item_deadline', true );
 593          }
 594  
 595          // SLUG:
 596          if( param( 'post_urltitle', 'string', NULL ) !== NULL ) {
 597              $this->set_from_Request( 'urltitle' );
 598          }
 599  
 600          // <title> TAG:
 601          if( param( 'titletag', 'string', NULL ) !== NULL ) {
 602              $this->set_from_Request( 'titletag', 'titletag' );
 603          }
 604  
 605          // <meta> DESC:
 606          if( param( 'metadesc', 'string', NULL ) !== NULL ) {
 607              $this->set_setting( 'post_metadesc', get_param( 'metadesc' ) );
 608          }
 609  
 610          // <meta> KEYWORDS:
 611          if( param( 'custom_headers', 'string', NULL ) !== NULL ) {
 612              $this->set_setting( 'post_custom_headers', get_param( 'custom_headers' ) );
 613          }
 614  
 615          // TAGS:
 616          if( param( 'item_tags', 'string', NULL ) !== NULL ) {
 617              $this->set_tags_from_string( get_param('item_tags') );
 618              // pre_dump( $this->tags );
 619          }
 620  
 621          // WORKFLOW stuff:
 622          param( 'item_st_ID', 'integer', NULL );
 623          $this->set_from_Request( 'pst_ID', 'item_st_ID', true );
 624  
 625          $item_assigned_user_ID = param( 'item_assigned_user_ID', 'integer', NULL );
 626          $item_assigned_user_login = param( 'item_assigned_user_login', 'string', NULL );
 627          $this->assign_to( $item_assigned_user_ID, $item_assigned_user_login );
 628  
 629          $item_priority = param( 'item_priority', 'integer', NULL );
 630          if( $item_priority !== NULL )
 631          { // Set task priority only if it is gone from form
 632              $this->set_from_Request( 'priority', 'item_priority', true );
 633          }
 634  
 635          // FEATURED checkbox:
 636          $this->set( 'featured', param( 'item_featured', 'integer', 0 ), false );
 637  
 638          // HIDE TEASER checkbox:
 639          $this->set_setting( 'hide_teaser', param( 'item_hideteaser', 'integer', 0 ) );
 640  
 641          // ORDER:
 642          param( 'item_order', 'double', NULL );
 643          $this->set_from_Request( 'order', 'item_order', true );
 644  
 645          // OWNER:
 646          $this->creator_user_login = param( 'item_owner_login', 'string', NULL );
 647          if( $current_User->check_perm( 'users', 'edit' ) && param( 'item_owner_login_displayed', 'string', NULL ) !== NULL )
 648          {    // only admins can change the owner..
 649              if( param_check_not_empty( 'item_owner_login', T_('Please enter valid owner login.') ) && param_check_login( 'item_owner_login', true ) )
 650              {
 651                  $this->set_creator_by_login( $this->creator_user_login );
 652              }
 653          }
 654  
 655          // LOCATION COORDINATES:
 656          if( $this->Blog->get_setting( 'show_location_coordinates' ) )
 657          { // location coordinates are enabled, save map settings
 658              param( 'item_latitude', 'double', NULL ); // get par value
 659              $this->set_setting( 'latitude', get_param( 'item_latitude' ), true );
 660              param( 'item_longitude', 'double', NULL ); // get par value
 661              $this->set_setting( 'longitude', get_param( 'item_longitude' ), true );
 662              param( 'google_map_zoom', 'integer', NULL ); // get par value
 663              $this->set_setting( 'map_zoom', get_param( 'google_map_zoom' ), true );
 664              param( 'google_map_type', 'string', NULL ); // get par value
 665              $this->set_setting( 'map_type', get_param( 'google_map_type' ), true );
 666          }
 667  
 668          // CUSTOM FIELDS:
 669          foreach( array( 'double', 'varchar' ) as $type )
 670          {
 671              $field_count = $this->Blog->get_setting( 'count_custom_'.$type );
 672              for( $i = 1 ; $i <= $field_count; $i++ )
 673              { // update each custom field
 674                  $field_guid = $this->Blog->get_setting( 'custom_'.$type.$i );
 675                  $param_name = 'item_'.$type.'_'.$field_guid;
 676                  if( isset_param( $param_name ) )
 677                  { // param is set
 678                      $param_type = ( $type == 'varchar' ) ? 'string' : $type;
 679                      param( $param_name, $param_type, NULL ); // get par value
 680                      $custom_field_make_null = $type != 'double'; // store '0' values in DB for numeric fields
 681                      $this->set_setting( 'custom_'.$type.'_'.$field_guid, get_param( $param_name ), $custom_field_make_null );
 682                  }
 683              }
 684          }
 685  
 686          // COMMENTS:
 687          if( ( $this->Blog->get_setting( 'allow_comments' ) != 'never' ) && ( $this->Blog->get_setting( 'disable_comments_bypost' ) ) )
 688          {    // Save status of "Allow comments for this item" (only if comments are allowed in this blog, and disable_comments_bypost is enabled):
 689              $post_comment_status = param( 'post_comment_status', 'string', 'open' );
 690              if( !empty( $post_comment_status ) )
 691              { // 'open' or 'closed' or ...
 692                  $this->set_from_Request( 'comment_status' );
 693              }
 694          }
 695  
 696          // EXPIRY DELAY:
 697          $expiry_delay = param_duration( 'expiry_delay' );
 698          if( empty( $expiry_delay ) )
 699          { // Check if we have 'expiry_delay' param set as string from simple or mass form
 700              $expiry_delay = param( 'expiry_delay', 'string', NULL );
 701          }
 702          $this->set_setting( 'post_expiry_delay', $expiry_delay, true );
 703  
 704          // EXTRA PARAMS FROM MODULES:
 705          modules_call_method( 'update_item_settings', array( 'edited_Item' => $this ) );
 706  
 707          // RENDERERS:
 708          if( param( 'renderers_displayed', 'integer', 0 ) )
 709          { // use "renderers" value only if it has been displayed (may be empty)
 710              global $Plugins;
 711              $renderers = $Plugins->validate_renderer_list( param( 'renderers', 'array/string', array() ), array( 'Item' => & $this ) );
 712              $this->set( 'renderers', $renderers );
 713          }
 714          else
 715          {
 716              $renderers = $this->get_renderers_validated();
 717          }
 718  
 719          // CONTENT + TITLE:
 720          if( $this->Blog->get_setting( 'allow_html_post' ) )
 721          {    // HTML is allowed for this post, we'll accept HTML tags:
 722              $text_format = 'html';
 723          }
 724          else
 725          {    // HTML is disallowed for this post, we'll encode all special chars:
 726              $text_format = 'htmlspecialchars';
 727          }
 728  
 729          $editor_code = param( 'editor_code', 'string', NULL );
 730          if( !empty( $editor_code ) )
 731          { // Update item editor code if it was explicitly set
 732              $this->set_setting( 'editor_code', $editor_code );
 733          }
 734  
 735          if( param( 'content', $text_format, NULL ) !== NULL )
 736          {
 737              // Never allow html content on post titles:  (fp> probably so as to not mess up backoffice and all sorts of tools)
 738              param( 'post_title', 'htmlspecialchars', NULL );
 739  
 740              // Do some optional filtering on the content
 741              // Typically stuff that will help the content to validate
 742              // Useful for code display.
 743              // Will probably be used for validation also.
 744              $Plugins_admin = & get_Plugins_admin();
 745              $params = array( 'object_type' => 'Item', 'object_Blog' => & $this->Blog );
 746              $Plugins_admin->filter_contents( $GLOBALS['post_title'] /* by ref */, $GLOBALS['content'] /* by ref */, $renderers, $params /* by ref */ );
 747  
 748              // Title checking:
 749              $require_title = $this->Blog->get_setting('require_title');
 750  
 751              if( ( ! $editing || $creating ) && $require_title == 'required' ) // creating is important, when the action is create_edit
 752              {
 753                  param_check_not_empty( 'post_title', T_('Please provide a title.'), '' );
 754              }
 755  
 756              // Format raw HTML input to cleaned up and validated HTML:
 757              param_check_html( 'content', T_('Invalid content.') );
 758              $content = prepare_item_content( get_param( 'content' ) );
 759  
 760              $this->set( 'content', $content );
 761  
 762              $this->set( 'title', get_param( 'post_title' ) );
 763          }
 764  
 765          // EXCERPT: (must come after content (to handle excerpt_autogenerated))
 766          if( param( 'post_excerpt', 'text', NULL ) !== NULL )
 767          {
 768              $this->set( 'excerpt_autogenerated', 0 ); // Set this to the '0' for saving a field 'excerpt' from a request
 769              $this->set_from_Request( 'excerpt' );
 770          }
 771  
 772          // LOCATION (COUNTRY -> CITY):
 773          load_funcs( 'regional/model/_regional.funcs.php' );
 774          if( $this->Blog->country_visible() )
 775          { // Save country
 776              $country_ID = param( 'item_ctry_ID', 'integer', 0 );
 777              $country_is_required = $this->Blog->get_setting( 'location_country' ) == 'required'
 778                      && countries_exist()
 779                      && ! $this->is_special();
 780              param_check_number( 'item_ctry_ID', T_('Please select a country'), $country_is_required );
 781              $this->set_from_Request( 'ctry_ID', 'item_ctry_ID', true );
 782          }
 783  
 784          if( $this->Blog->region_visible() )
 785          { // Save region
 786              $region_ID = param( 'item_rgn_ID', 'integer', 0 );
 787              $region_is_required = $this->Blog->get_setting( 'location_region' ) == 'required'
 788                      && regions_exist( $country_ID )
 789                      && ! $this->is_special();
 790              param_check_number( 'item_rgn_ID', T_('Please select a region'), $region_is_required );
 791              $this->set_from_Request( 'rgn_ID', 'item_rgn_ID', true );
 792          }
 793  
 794          if( $this->Blog->subregion_visible() )
 795          { // Save subregion
 796              $subregion_ID = param( 'item_subrg_ID', 'integer', 0 );
 797              $subregion_is_required = $this->Blog->get_setting( 'location_subregion' ) == 'required'
 798                      && subregions_exist( $region_ID )
 799                      && ! $this->is_special();
 800              param_check_number( 'item_subrg_ID', T_('Please select a sub-region'), $subregion_is_required );
 801              $this->set_from_Request( 'subrg_ID', 'item_subrg_ID', true );
 802          }
 803  
 804          if( $this->Blog->city_visible() )
 805          { // Save city
 806              param( 'item_city_ID', 'integer', 0 );
 807              $city_is_required = $this->Blog->get_setting( 'location_city' ) == 'required'
 808                      && cities_exist( $country_ID, $region_ID, $subregion_ID )
 809                      && ! $this->is_special();
 810              param_check_number( 'item_city_ID', T_('Please select a city'), $city_is_required );
 811              $this->set_from_Request( 'city_ID', 'item_city_ID', true );
 812          }
 813  
 814          return ! param_errors_detected();
 815      }

 885      /**
 886       * Check if user can see comments on this post, which he cannot if they
 887       * are disabled for the Item or never allowed for the blog.
 888       *
 889       * @param boolean true will display why user can't see comments
 890       * @return boolean
 891       */
 892  	function can_see_comments( $display = false )
 893      {
 894          global $Settings;
 895  
 896          $this->load_Blog();
 897          if( $this->Blog->get_setting( 'disable_comments_bypost' ) && ( $this->comment_status == 'disabled' ) )
 898          { // Comments are disabled on this post
 899              return false;
 900          }
 901  
 902          if( $this->check_blog_settings( 'allow_view_comments' ) )
 903          { // User is allowed to see comments
 904              return true;
 905          }
 906  
 907          if( !$display )
 908          {
 909              return false;
 910          }
 911  
 912          $number_of_comments = $this->get_number_of_comments( 'published' );
 913          $allow_view_comments = $this->Blog->get_setting( 'allow_view_comments' );
 914          $user_can_be_validated = check_user_status( 'can_be_validated' );
 915  
 916          if( ( $allow_view_comments != 'any' ) && ( $user_can_be_validated ) )
 917          { // change allow view comments to activated, because user is logged in but the account is not activated, and anomnymous users can't see comments
 918              $allow_view_comments = 'active_users';
 919          }
 920  
 921          // Set display text
 922          switch( $allow_view_comments )
 923          {
 924              case 'active_users':
 925                  // users must activate their accounts before they can see the comments
 926                  if( $number_of_comments == 0 )
 927                  {
 928                      $display_text = T_( 'You must activate your account to see the comments.' );
 929                  }
 930                  elseif ( $number_of_comments == 1 )
 931                  {
 932                      $display_text = T_( 'There is <b>one comment</b> on this post but you must activate your account to see the comments.' );
 933                  }
 934                  else
 935                  {
 936                      $display_text = sprintf( T_( 'There are <b>%s comments</b> on this post but you must activate your account to see the comments.' ), $number_of_comments );
 937                  }
 938                  break;
 939  
 940              case 'registered':
 941                  // only registered users can see this post's comments
 942                  if( $number_of_comments == 0 )
 943                  {
 944                      $display_text = T_( 'You must be logged in to see the comments.' );
 945                  }
 946                  elseif ( $number_of_comments == 1 )
 947                  {
 948                      $display_text = T_( 'There is <b>one comment</b> on this post but you must be logged in to see the comments.' );
 949                  }
 950                  else
 951                  {
 952                      $display_text = sprintf( T_( 'There are <b>%s comments</b> on this post but you must be logged in to see the comments.' ), $number_of_comments );
 953                  }
 954                  break;
 955  
 956              case 'member':
 957                  // only members can see this post's comments
 958                  if( $number_of_comments == 0 )
 959                  {
 960                      $display_text = T_( 'You must be a member of this blog to see the comments.' );
 961                  }
 962                  elseif ( $number_of_comments == 1 )
 963                  {
 964                      $display_text = T_( 'There is one comment on this post but you must be a member of this blog to see the comments.' );
 965                  }
 966                  else
 967                  {
 968                      $display_text = sprintf( T_( 'There are %s comments on this post but you must be a member of this blog to see the comments.' ), $number_of_comments );
 969                  }
 970                  break;
 971  
 972              default:
 973                  // any is already handled, moderators shouldn't get any message
 974                  return false;
 975          }
 976  
 977          echo '<div class="comment_posting_disabled_msg">';
 978  
 979          if( !is_logged_in() )
 980          { // user is not logged in at all
 981              $redirect_to = $this->get_permanent_url().'#comments';
 982              $login_link = '<a href="'.get_login_url( 'cannot see comments', $redirect_to ).'">'.T_( 'Log in now!' ).'</a>';
 983              echo '<p>'.$display_text.' '.$login_link.'</p>';
 984              if( $Settings->get( 'newusers_canregister' ) && $Settings->get( 'registration_is_public' ) )
 985              { // needs to display register link
 986                  echo '<p>'.sprintf( T_( 'If you have no account yet, you can <a href="%s">register now</a>...<br />(It only takes a few seconds!)' ),
 987                              get_user_register_url( $redirect_to, 'reg to see comments' ) ).'</p>';
 988              }
 989          }
 990          elseif( $user_can_be_validated )
 991          { // user is logged in but not activated
 992              $activateinfo_link = '<a href="'.get_activate_info_url( $this->get_permanent_url().'#comments' ).'">'.T_( 'More info &raquo;' ).'</a>';
 993              echo '<p>'.$display_text.' '.$activateinfo_link.'</p>';
 994          }
 995          else
 996          { // user is activated, but not allowed to view comments
 997              echo $display_text;
 998          }
 999  
1000          echo '</div>';
1001  
1002          return false;
1003      }
1004  
1005  
1006      /**
1007       * Template function: Check if user can leave comment on this post or display error
1008       *
1009       * @param string|NULL string to display before any error message; NULL to not display anything, but just return boolean
1010       * @param string string to display after any error message
1011       * @param string error message for non published posts, '#' for default
1012       * @param string error message for closed comments posts, '#' for default
1013       * @param string section title
1014       * @param array Skin params
1015       * @return boolean true if user can post, false if s/he cannot
1016       */
1017  	function can_comment( $before_error = '<p><em>', $after_error = '</em></p>', $non_published_msg = '#', $closed_msg = '#', $section_title = '', $params = array() )
1018      {
1019          global $current_User;
1020  
1021          $display = ( ! is_null($before_error) );
1022  
1023          if( $display )
1024          { // display a comment form section even if comment form won't be displayed, "add new comment" links should point to this section
1025              echo '<a id="form_p'.$this->ID.'"></a>';
1026          }
1027  
1028          if( $this->check_blog_settings( 'allow_comments' ) )
1029          {
1030              if( $this->Blog->get_setting( 'disable_comments_bypost' ) && ( $this->comment_status == 'disabled' ) )
1031              { // Comments are disabled on this post
1032                  return false;
1033              }
1034  
1035              if( $this->comment_status == 'closed' || $this->is_locked() )
1036              { // Comments are closed on this post
1037  
1038                  if( $display)
1039                  {
1040                      if( $closed_msg == '#' )
1041                          $closed_msg = T_( 'Comments are closed for this post.' );
1042  
1043                      echo $before_error;
1044                      echo $closed_msg;
1045                      echo $after_error;
1046                  }
1047  
1048                  return false;
1049              }
1050  
1051              if( ($this->status == 'draft') || ($this->status == 'deprecated' ) || ($this->status == 'redirected' ) )
1052              { // Post is not published
1053  
1054                  if( $display )
1055                  {
1056                      if( $non_published_msg == '#' )
1057                          $non_published_msg = T_( 'This post is not published. You cannot leave comments.' );
1058  
1059                      echo $before_error;
1060                      echo $non_published_msg;
1061                      echo $after_error;
1062                  }
1063  
1064                  return false;
1065              }
1066  
1067              if( is_logged_in() && ( $this->Blog->get( 'advanced_perms' ) ) && !$current_User->check_perm( 'blog_comment_statuses', 'create', false, $this->Blog->ID ) )
1068              { // User doesn't have permission to create comments and advanced perms are enabled
1069                  if( $display )
1070                  {
1071                      echo $before_error;
1072                      echo T_('You don\'t have permission to reply on this post.');
1073                      echo $after_error;
1074                  }
1075                  return false;
1076              }
1077              return true; // OK, user can comment!
1078          }
1079  
1080          if( ( $this->Blog->get_setting( 'allow_comments' ) != 'never' ) && $display )
1081          {
1082              if( $this->comment_status == 'closed' || $this->comment_status == 'disabled' )
1083              {    // Don't display the disabled comment form because we cannot create the comments for this post
1084                  return false;
1085              }
1086              echo $section_title;
1087              // set item_url for redirect after login, if login required
1088              $item_url = $this->get_permanent_url().'#form_p'.$this->ID;
1089              // display disabled comment form
1090              echo_disabled_comments( $this->Blog->get_setting( 'allow_comments' ), $item_url, $params );
1091          }
1092  
1093          // Current user not allowed to comment in this blog
1094          return false;
1095      }
1096  
1097  
1098      /**
1099       * Check if current user is allowed for several action in this post's blog
1100       *
1101       * @private function
1102       *
1103       * @param string blog settings name. Param value can be 'allow_comments', 'allow_attachments','allow_rating_items'
1104       * @return boolean  true if user is allowed for the corresponding action
1105       */
1106  	function check_blog_settings( $settings_name )
1107      {
1108          global $current_User;
1109  
1110          $this->load_Blog();
1111  
1112          switch( $this->Blog->get_setting( $settings_name ) )
1113          {
1114              case 'never':
1115                  return false;
1116              case 'any':
1117                  return true;
1118              case 'registered':
1119                  return is_logged_in( false );
1120              case 'member':
1121                  return (is_logged_in( false ) && $current_User->check_perm( 'blog_ismember', 'view', false, $this->get_blog_ID() ) );
1122              case 'moderator':
1123                  return (is_logged_in( false ) && $current_User->check_perm( 'blog_comments', 'edit', false, $this->get_blog_ID() ) );
1124              default:
1125                  debug_die( 'Invalid blog '.$settings_name.' settings!' );
1126          }
1127  
1128          return false;
1129      }
1130  
1131  
1132      /**
1133       * Template function: Check if user can attach files to this post comments
1134       *
1135       * @return boolean true if user can attach files to this post comments, false if s/he cannot
1136       */
1137  	function can_attach()
1138      {
1139          global $Settings;
1140  
1141          $attachments_quota_is_full = false;
1142          if( is_logged_in() )
1143          {    // We can check the attachments quota only for registered users
1144              $this->load_Blog();
1145              $max_attachments = (int)$this->Blog->get_setting( 'max_attachments' );
1146              if( $max_attachments > 0 )
1147              {    // Check attachments quota only when Blog setting "Max # of attachments" is defined
1148                  global $DB, $current_User, $Session;
1149  
1150                  // Get a number of attachments for current user on this post
1151                  $attachments_count = $this->get_attachments_number();
1152  
1153                  // Get the attachments from preview comment
1154                  global $checked_attachments;
1155                  if( !empty( $checked_attachments ) )
1156                  {    // Calculate also the attachments in the PREVIEW mode
1157                      $attachments_count += count( explode( ',', $checked_attachments ) );
1158                  }
1159  
1160                  if( $attachments_count >= $max_attachments )
1161                  {    // Current user already has max number of attachments on this post
1162                      $attachments_quota_is_full = true;
1163                  }
1164              }
1165          }
1166  
1167          return !$attachments_quota_is_full && $this->check_blog_settings( 'allow_attachments' ) && $Settings->get( 'upload_enabled' );
1168      }
1169  
1170  
1171      /**
1172       * Check if the post contains inline image placeholders without corresponding attachemnt file.
1173       * Removes the invalid inline image placeholders from the item content.
1174       */
1175  	function check_and_clear_inline_images()
1176      {
1177          global $Messages;
1178  
1179          $original_content = $this->content;
1180          preg_match_all( '/\[image:(\d+):?[^\]]*\]/i', $this->content, $inline_images );
1181  
1182          if( empty( $inline_images[1] ) )
1183          { // There are no inline image placeholders in the post content
1184              return;
1185          }
1186  
1187          // There are inline image placeholders
1188          if( $this->ID > 0 )
1189          { // The post is not saved yet, so it can not contains attachments
1190              global $DB;
1191              $links_SQL = new SQL();
1192              $links_SQL->SELECT( 'link_ID' );
1193              $links_SQL->FROM( 'T_links' );
1194              $links_SQL->WHERE( 'link_itm_ID = '.$DB->quote( $this->ID ) );
1195              $links_SQL->WHERE_and( 'link_position = "inline"' );
1196              $inline_links_IDs = $DB->get_col( $links_SQL->get(), 0, 'Get item links IDs of the inline images' );
1197  
1198              $unused_inline_images = array();
1199              foreach( $inline_images[1] as $i => $inline_link_ID )
1200              {
1201                  if( ! in_array( $inline_link_ID, $inline_links_IDs ) )
1202                  { // This inline image must be removed from content
1203                      $unused_inline_images[] = $inline_images[0][ $i ];
1204                  }
1205              }
1206          }
1207          else
1208          { // The post is not saved yet, so it can not contains attachments. None of the placeholders are used.
1209              $unused_inline_images = $inline_images[0];
1210          }
1211  
1212          // Clear the unused inline images from content
1213          if( count( $unused_inline_images ) )
1214          { // Remove all unused inline images from the content
1215              $this->content = str_replace( $unused_inline_images, '', $this->content );
1216              $Messages->add( T_('Invalid inline image placeholders were removed.'), 'note' );
1217          }
1218      }
1219  
1220  
1221      /**
1222       * Get a number of attachments on this post
1223       *
1224       * @param object User
1225       * @return integer Number of attachments
1226       */
1227  	function get_attachments_number( $User = NULL )
1228      {
1229          global $DB, $cache_item_attachments_number;
1230  
1231          if( is_null( $User ) )
1232          {    // Use current user by default
1233              global $current_User;
1234              $User = $current_User;
1235          }
1236  
1237          if( !isset( $cache_item_attachments_number ) )
1238          {    // Init cache variable at first time
1239              $cache_item_attachments_number = array();
1240          }
1241  
1242          if( isset( $cache_item_attachments_number[$User->ID] ) )
1243          {    // Get a number of attachments from cache variable
1244              return $cache_item_attachments_number[$User->ID];
1245          }
1246  
1247          // Get a number of attachments from DB
1248          $SQL = new SQL();
1249          $SQL->SELECT( 'COUNT( link_ID )' );
1250          $SQL->FROM( 'T_links' );
1251          $SQL->FROM_add( 'INNER JOIN T_comments ON comment_ID = link_cmt_ID' );
1252          $SQL->WHERE( 'link_creator_user_ID = '.$DB->quote( $User->ID ) );
1253          $SQL->WHERE_and( 'comment_item_ID = '.$DB->quote( $this->ID ) );
1254          $cache_item_attachments_number[$User->ID] = (int)$DB->get_var( $SQL->get() );
1255  
1256          return $cache_item_attachments_number[$User->ID];
1257      }
1258

1260      /**
1261       * Get how much files user can attach on this post yet
1262       *
1263       * @param object User
1264       * @return integer|string Number of files which current user can attach to this post | 'unlimit'
1265       */
1266  	function get_attachments_limit( $User = NULL )
1267      {
1268          if( is_logged_in() )
1269          {    // We can check the attachments quota only for registered users
1270              $this->load_Blog();
1271              $max_attachments = (int)$this->Blog->get_setting( 'max_attachments' );
1272              if( $max_attachments > 0 )
1273              {    // Get a limit only when Blog setting "Max # of attachments" is defined
1274                  return $max_attachments - $this->get_attachments_number( $User );
1275              }
1276          }
1277  
1278          return 'unlimit';
1279      }

1287  	function can_rate()

1289          return $this->check_blog_settings( 'allow_rating_items' );

1293      /**
1294       * Get the prerendered content. If it has not been generated yet, it will.
1295       *
1296       * NOTE: This calls {@link Item::dbupdate()}, if renderers get changed (from Plugin hook).
1297       *       (not for preview though)
1298       *
1299       * @param string Format, see {@link format_to_output()}.
1300       *        Only "htmlbody", "entityencoded", "xml" and "text" get cached.
1301       * @return string
1302       */
1303  	function get_prerendered_content( $format )
1304      {
1305          global $Plugins;
1306          global $preview;
1307  
1308          if( $preview )
1309          {
1310              $this->update_renderers_from_Plugins();
1311              $post_renderers = $this->get_renderers_validated();
1312  
1313              // Call RENDERER plugins:
1314              $r = $this->content;
1315              $Plugins->render( $r /* by ref */, $post_renderers, $format, array( 'Item' => $this ), 'Render' );
1316  
1317              return $r;
1318          }
1319  
1320  
1321          $r = null;
1322  
1323          $post_renderers = $this->get_renderers_validated();
1324          $cache_key = $format.'/'.implode('.', $post_renderers); // logic gets used below, for setting cache, too.
1325  
1326          $use_cache = $this->ID && in_array( $format, array('htmlbody', 'entityencoded', 'xml', 'text') );
1327  
1328          // $use_cache = false;
1329  
1330          if( $use_cache )
1331          { // the format/item can be cached:
1332              $ItemPrerenderingCache = & get_ItemPrerenderingCache();
1333  
1334              if( isset($ItemPrerenderingCache[$format][$this->ID][$cache_key]) )
1335              { // already in PHP cache.
1336                  $r = $ItemPrerenderingCache[$format][$this->ID][$cache_key];
1337                  // Save memory, typically only accessed once.
1338                  unset($ItemPrerenderingCache[$format][$this->ID][$cache_key]);
1339              }
1340              else
1341              {    // Try loading from DB cache, including all items in MainList/ItemList.
1342                  global $DB;
1343  
1344                  if( ! isset($ItemPrerenderingCache[$format]) )
1345                  { // only do the prefetch loading once.
1346                      $prefetch_IDs = $this->get_prefetch_itemlist_IDs();
1347  
1348                      // Load prerendered content for all items in MainList/ItemList.
1349                      // We load the current $format only, since it's most likely that only one gets used.
1350                      $ItemPrerenderingCache[$format] = array();
1351  
1352                      $rows = $DB->get_results( "
1353                          SELECT itpr_itm_ID, itpr_format, itpr_renderers, itpr_content_prerendered
1354                              FROM T_items__prerendering
1355                           WHERE itpr_itm_ID IN (".$DB->quote( $prefetch_IDs ).")
1356                               AND itpr_format = '".$format."'",
1357                               OBJECT, 'Preload prerendered item content for MainList/ItemList ('.$format.')' );
1358                      foreach($rows as $row)
1359                      {
1360                          $row_cache_key = $row->itpr_format.'/'.$row->itpr_renderers;
1361  
1362                          if( ! isset($ItemPrerenderingCache[$format][$row->itpr_itm_ID]) )
1363                          { // init list
1364                              $ItemPrerenderingCache[$format][$row->itpr_itm_ID] = array();
1365                          }
1366  
1367                          $ItemPrerenderingCache[$format][$row->itpr_itm_ID][$row_cache_key] = $row->itpr_content_prerendered;
1368                      }
1369  
1370                      // Set the value for current Item.
1371                      if( isset($ItemPrerenderingCache[$format][$this->ID][$cache_key]) )
1372                      {
1373                          $r = $ItemPrerenderingCache[$format][$this->ID][$cache_key];
1374                          // Save memory, typically only accessed once.
1375                          unset($ItemPrerenderingCache[$format][$this->ID][$cache_key]);
1376                      }
1377                  }
1378                  else
1379                  { // This item has not been fetched by the initial prefetch query; only get this item.
1380                      // dh> This is quite unlikely to happen, but you never know.
1381                      // This gets not added to ItemPrerenderingCache, since it would only waste
1382                      // memory - an item gets typically only accessed once per page, and even if
1383                      // it would get accessed more often, there is a cache higher in the chain
1384                      // ($this->content_pages).
1385                      $cache = $DB->get_var( "
1386                          SELECT itpr_content_prerendered
1387                              FROM T_items__prerendering
1388                           WHERE itpr_itm_ID = ".$this->ID."
1389                               AND itpr_format = '".$format."'
1390                               AND itpr_renderers = '".implode('.', $post_renderers)."'", 0, 0, 'Check prerendered item content' );
1391                      if( $cache !== NULL ) // may be empty string
1392                      { // Retrieved from cache:
1393                          // echo ' retrieved from prerendered cache';
1394                          $r = $cache;
1395                      }
1396                  }
1397              }
1398          }
1399  
1400          if( ! isset( $r ) )
1401          {    // Not cached yet:
1402              global $Debuglog;
1403  
1404              if( $this->update_renderers_from_Plugins() )
1405              {
1406                  $post_renderers = $this->get_renderers_validated(); // might have changed from call above
1407                  $cache_key = $format.'/'.implode('.', $post_renderers);
1408  
1409                  // Save new renderers with item:
1410                  $this->dbupdate();
1411              }
1412  
1413              // Call RENDERER plugins:
1414              // pre_dump( $this->content );
1415              $r = $this->content;
1416              $Plugins->render( $r /* by ref */, $post_renderers, $format, array( 'Item' => $this ), 'Render' );
1417              // pre_dump( $r );
1418  
1419              $Debuglog->add( 'Generated pre-rendered content ['.$cache_key.'] for item #'.$this->ID, 'items' );
1420  
1421              if( $use_cache )
1422              { // save into DB (using REPLACE INTO because it may have been pre-rendered by another thread since the SELECT above)
1423                  $DB->query( "
1424                      REPLACE INTO T_items__prerendering (itpr_itm_ID, itpr_format, itpr_renderers, itpr_content_prerendered)
1425                       VALUES ( ".$this->ID.", '".$format."', ".$DB->quote(implode('.', $post_renderers)).', '.$DB->quote($r).' )', 'Cache prerendered item content' );
1426              }
1427          }
1428  
1429          return $r;
1430      }
1431  
1432  
1433      /**
1434       * Unset any prerendered content for this item (in PHP cache).
1435       */
1436  	function delete_prerendered_content()
1437      {
1438          global $DB;
1439  
1440          // Delete DB rows.
1441          $DB->query( 'DELETE FROM T_items__prerendering WHERE itpr_itm_ID = '.$this->ID );
1442  
1443          // Delete cache.
1444          $ItemPrerenderingCache = & get_ItemPrerenderingCache();
1445          foreach( array_keys($ItemPrerenderingCache) as $format )
1446          {
1447              unset($ItemPrerenderingCache[$format][$this->ID]);
1448          }
1449  
1450          // Delete derived properties.
1451          unset($this->content_pages);
1452      }

1455      /**
1456       * Trigger {@link Plugin::ItemApplyAsRenderer()} event and adjust renderers according
1457       * to return value.
1458       * @return boolean True if renderers got changed.
1459       */
1460  	function update_renderers_from_Plugins()
1461      {
1462          global $Plugins;
1463  
1464          $r = false;
1465  
1466          if( !isset($Plugins) )
1467          {    // This can happen in maintenance modules running with minimal init, during install, or in tests.
1468              return $r;
1469          }
1470  
1471          foreach( $Plugins->get_list_by_event('ItemApplyAsRenderer') as $Plugin )
1472          {
1473              if( empty($Plugin->code) )
1474                  continue;
1475  
1476              $plugin_r = $Plugin->ItemApplyAsRenderer( $tmp_params = array('Item' => & $this) );
1477  
1478              if( is_bool($plugin_r) )
1479              {
1480                  if( $plugin_r )
1481                  {
1482                      $r = $this->add_renderer( $Plugin->code ) || $r;
1483                  }
1484                  else
1485                  {
1486                      $r = $this->remove_renderer( $Plugin->code ) || $r;
1487                  }
1488              }
1489          }
1490  
1491          return $r;
1492      }

1495      /**
1496       * Display excerpt of an item.
1497       * @param array Associative list of params
1498       *   - before
1499       *   - after
1500       *   - excerpt_before_more
1501       *   - excerpt_after_more
1502       *   - excerpt_more_text
1503       *   - format
1504       *   - allow_empty: force generation if excert is empty (Default: false)
1505       *   - update_db: update the DB if we generated an excerpt (Default: true)
1506       */
1507  	function excerpt( $params = array() )
1508      {
1509          // Make sure we are not missing any param:
1510          $params = array_merge( array(
1511                  'before'              => '<div class="excerpt">',
1512                  'after'               => '</div>',
1513                  'excerpt_before_more' => ' <span class="excerpt_more">',
1514                  'excerpt_after_more'  => '</span>',
1515                  'excerpt_more_text'   => T_('more').' &raquo;',
1516                  'format'              => 'htmlbody',
1517                  'allow_empty'         => false,
1518                  'update_db'           => true,
1519              ), $params );
1520  
1521          $r = $this->get_excerpt2( $params );
1522  
1523          if( ! empty( $r ) )
1524          {
1525              echo $params['before'];
1526              echo format_to_output( $this->excerpt, $params['format'] );
1527              if( !empty( $params['excerpt_more_text'] ) )
1528              {
1529                  echo $params['excerpt_before_more'];
1530                  echo '<a href="'.$this->get_permanent_url().'">'.$params['excerpt_more_text'].'</a>';
1531                  echo $params['excerpt_after_more'];
1532              }
1533              echo $params['after'];
1534          }
1535      }
1536  
1537  
1538      /**
1539       * Get item excerpt.
1540       *
1541       * @todo fp>blueyed WTF? Same function name as in ItemLight but different params!
1542       * fp> NOTE: I think we can't move this code to ItemLight because we can't update the excerpt there since we don't have the post text there
1543       *
1544       * @param array Associative list of params
1545       *   - allow_empty: force generation if excert is empty (Default: false)
1546       *   - update_db: update the DB if we generated an excerpt (Default: true)
1547       * @return string
1548       */
1549  	function get_excerpt2( $params = array() )
1550      {
1551          $params += array(
1552              'allow_empty' => false,
1553              'update_db' => true,
1554              );
1555  
1556          if( ! $params['allow_empty'] )
1557          {    // Make sure excerpt the excerpt is not empty by updating it automatically if needed:
1558              if( $this->update_excerpt() && $params['update_db'] && $this->ID )
1559              {    // We have updated... let's also update the DB:
1560                  $this->dbupdate( false );        // Do not auto track modification date.
1561              }
1562          }
1563          return $this->excerpt;
1564      }

1567      /**
1568       * Make sure, the pages have been obtained (and split up_ from prerendered cache.
1569       *
1570       * @param string Format, used to retrieve the matching cache; see {@link format_to_output()}
1571       */
1572  	function split_pages( $format = 'htmlbody' )
1573      {
1574          if( ! isset( $this->content_pages[ $format ] ) )
1575          {
1576              // SPLIT PAGES:
1577              $this->content_pages[ $format ] = split_outcode( '[pagebreak]', $this->get_prerendered_content( $format ) );
1578  
1579              // Balance HTML tags
1580              $this->content_pages[ $format ] = array_map( 'balance_tags', $this->content_pages[ $format ] );
1581  
1582              $this->pages = count( $this->content_pages[ $format ] );
1583          }
1584      }
1585  
1586  
1587      /**
1588       * Get a specific page to display (from the prerendered cache)
1589       *
1590       * @param integer Page number, NULL/"#" for current
1591       * @param string Format, used to retrieve the matching cache; see {@link format_to_output()}
1592       */
1593  	function get_content_page( $page = NULL, $format = 'htmlbody' )
1594      {
1595          // Get requested content page:
1596          if( ! isset($page) || $page === '#' )
1597          { // We want to display the page requested by the user:
1598              $page = isset($GLOBALS['page']) ? $GLOBALS['page'] : 1;
1599          }
1600  
1601          // Make sure, the pages are split up:
1602          $this->split_pages( $format );
1603  
1604          if( $page < 1 )
1605          {
1606              $page = 1;
1607          }
1608  
1609          if( $page > $this->pages )
1610          {
1611              $page = $this->pages;
1612          }
1613  
1614          return $this->content_pages[$format][$page-1];
1615      }

1618      /**
1619       * This is like a teaser with no HTML and a cropping.
1620       *
1621       * Note: Excerpt and Teaser are TWO DIFFERENT THINGS.
1622       *
1623       * @param int Max length of excerpt
1624       * @return string
1625       */
1626  	function get_content_excerpt( $crop_at = 200 )
1627      {
1628          // Get teaser for page 1:
1629          $output = $this->get_content_teaser( 1, false, 'text' );
1630  
1631          return excerpt( $output, $crop_at );
1632      }

1635      /**
1636       * Display content teaser of item (will stop at "[teaserbreak]"
1637       */
1638  	function content_teaser( $params )
1639      {
1640          // Make sure we are not missing any param:
1641          $params = array_merge( array(
1642                  'before'      => '',
1643                  'after'       => '',
1644                  'disppage'    => '#',
1645                  'stripteaser' => '#',
1646                  'format'      => 'htmlbody',
1647              ), $params );
1648  
1649          $r = $this->get_content_teaser( $params['disppage'], $params['stripteaser'], $params['format'], $params );
1650  
1651          if( ! empty( $r ) )
1652          {
1653              echo $params['before'];
1654              echo $r;
1655              echo $params['after'];
1656          }
1657      }
1658  
1659      /**
1660       * Template function: get content teaser of item (will stop at "[teaserbreak]")
1661       *
1662       * @param mixed page number to display specific page, # for url parameter
1663       * @param boolean # if you don't want to repeat teaser after more link was pressed and <-- noteaser --> has been found
1664       * @param string filename to use to display more
1665       * @param array Params
1666       * @return string
1667       */
1668  	function get_content_teaser( $disppage = '#', $stripteaser = '#', $format = 'htmlbody', $params = array() )
1669      {
1670          global $Plugins, $preview, $Debuglog;
1671          global $more;
1672  
1673          $params = array_merge( $params, array(
1674                  'disppage' => $disppage,
1675                  'format' => $format
1676              ) );
1677  
1678          $view_type = 'full';
1679          if( $this->has_content_parts($params) )
1680          { // This is an extended post (has a more section):
1681              if( $stripteaser === '#' )
1682              {
1683                  // If we're in "more" mode and we want to strip the teaser, we'll strip:
1684                  $stripteaser = ( $more && $this->get_setting( 'hide_teaser' ) );
1685              }
1686  
1687              if( $stripteaser )
1688              {
1689                  return NULL;
1690              }
1691              $view_type = 'teaser';
1692          }
1693  
1694          $content_parts = $this->get_content_parts( $params );
1695          $output = array_shift( $content_parts );
1696  
1697          // Render Inline Images  [image:123:caption]  :
1698          $params['check_code_block'] = true;
1699          $output = $this->render_inline_images( $output, $params );
1700  
1701          // Trigger Display plugins FOR THE STUFF THAT WOULD NOT BE PRERENDERED:
1702          $output = $Plugins->render( $output, $this->get_renderers_validated(), $format, array(
1703                  'Item' => $this,
1704                  'preview' => $preview,
1705                  'dispmore' => ($more != 0),
1706                  'view_type' => $view_type,
1707              ), 'Display' );
1708  
1709          // Character conversions
1710          $output = format_to_output( $output, $format );
1711  
1712          return $output;
1713      }
1714  
1715  
1716      /**
1717       * Get content parts (split by "[teaserbreak]").
1718       *
1719       * @param array 'disppage', 'format'
1720       * @return array Array of content parts
1721       */
1722  	function get_content_parts( $params )
1723      {
1724          // Make sure we are not missing any param:
1725          $params = array_merge( array(
1726                  'disppage' => '#',
1727                  'format'   => 'htmlbody',
1728              ), $params );
1729  
1730          $content_page = $this->get_content_page( $params['disppage'], $params['format'] ); // cannot include format_to_output() because of the magic below.. eg '[teaserbreak]' will get stripped in "xml"
1731  
1732          $content_parts = split_outcode( '[teaserbreak]', $content_page );
1733  
1734          // Balance HTML tags
1735          $content_parts = array_map( 'balance_tags', $content_parts );
1736  
1737          return $content_parts;
1738      }

1757       * Display content extension of item (part after "[teaserbreak]")
1758       */
1759  	function content_extension( $params )
1760      {
1761          // Make sure we are not missing any param:
1762          $params = array_merge( array(
1763                  'before'      => '',
1764                  'after'       => '',
1765                  'disppage'    => '#',
1766                  'format'      => 'htmlbody',
1767                  'force_more'  => false,
1768              ), $params );
1769  
1770          $r = $this->get_content_extension( $params['disppage'], $params['force_more'], $params['format'] );
1771

1773          {

1775              echo $r;
1776              echo $params['after'];

1781      /**
1782       * Template function: get content extension of item (part after "[teaserbreak]")
1783       *
1784       * @param mixed page number to display specific page, # for url parameter
1785       * @param boolean
1786       * @param string filename to use to display more
1787       * @return string
1788       */
1789  	function get_content_extension( $disppage = '#', $force_more = false, $format = 'htmlbody' )
1790      {
1791          global $Plugins, $more, $preview;
1792  
1793          if( ! $more && ! $force_more )
1794          {    // NOT in more mode:
1795              return NULL;
1796          }
1797  
1798          $params = array('disppage' => $disppage, 'format' => $format);
1799          if( ! $this->has_content_parts( $params ) )
1800          { // This is NOT an extended post
1801              return NULL;
1802          }
1803  
1804          $content_parts = $this->get_content_parts( $params );
1805  
1806          // Output everything after [teaserbreak]
1807          array_shift($content_parts);
1808          $output = implode('', $content_parts);
1809  
1810          // Render Inline Images  [image:123:caption]  :
1811          $params['check_code_block'] = true;
1812          $output = $this->render_inline_images( $output, $params );
1813  
1814          // Trigger Display plugins FOR THE STUFF THAT WOULD NOT BE PRERENDERED:
1815          $output = $Plugins->render( $output, $this->get_renderers_validated(), $format, array(
1816                  'Item' => $this,
1817                  'preview' => $preview,
1818                  'dispmore' => true,
1819                  'view_type' => 'extension',
1820              ), 'Display' );
1821  
1822          // Character conversions
1823          $output = format_to_output( $output, $format );
1824  
1825          return $output;
1826      }

1841      /**
1842       * Load item custom field value by index
1843       *
1844       * @param String field index, this is the lowercase value of the trimmed field name ( whitespaces are converted to one '_' character )
1845       * @return boolean true on success false if custom field with this index doesn't exist
1846       */
1847  	function load_custom_field_value( $field_index )
1848      {
1849          if( empty( $this->custom_fields ) )
1850          { // load item custom_fields
1851              $this->custom_fields = get_item_custom_fields();
1852          }
1853  
1854          if( empty( $this->custom_fields[$field_index] ) )
1855          { // there is no such custom field
1856              return false;
1857          }
1858  
1859          if( empty( $this->custom_fields[$field_index]['value'] ) )
1860          { // get custom item field value from the item setting
1861              $this->custom_fields[$field_index]['value'] = $this->get_setting( 'custom_'.$this->custom_fields[$field_index]['name'] );
1862          }
1863          return true;
1864      }
1865  
1866  
1867      /**
1868       * Get item custom field value by index
1869       *
1870       * @param String field index, see {@link load_custom_field_value()}
1871       * @return mixed false if the field doesn't exist Double/String otherwise depending from the custom field type
1872       */
1873  	function get_custom_field_value( $field_index )
1874      {
1875          if( $this->load_custom_field_value( $field_index ) )
1876          {
1877              return $this->custom_fields[$field_index]['value'];
1878          }
1879          return false;
1880      }
1881  
1882  
1883      /**
1884       * Display custom field
1885       */
1886  	function custom( $params )
1887      {
1888          // Make sure we are not missing any param:
1889          $params = array_merge( array(
1890                  'before'        => ' ',
1891                  'after'         => ' ',
1892                  'format'        => 'htmlbody',
1893                  'decimals'      => 2,
1894                  'dec_point'     => '.',
1895                  'thousands_sep' => ',',
1896              ), $params );
1897  
1898          if( empty( $params['field'] ) )
1899          {
1900              return;
1901          }
1902  
1903          // Load custom field by index
1904          $field_index = $params['field'];
1905          if( !$this->load_custom_field_value( $field_index ) )
1906          { // Custom field with this index doesn't exist
1907              echo $params['before']
1908                  .'<span class="red">'.sprintf( T_('The custom field %s does not exist!'), $field_index ).'</span>'
1909                  .$params['after'];
1910              return;
1911          }
1912  
1913          // Get value and type
1914          $value = $this->custom_fields[$field_index]['value'];
1915          $type = $this->custom_fields[$field_index]['type'];
1916  
1917          if( !empty( $params['max'] ) && ( $type == 'double' ) && ( $value == 9999999999 ) )
1918          {
1919              echo $params['max'];
1920          }
1921          elseif( !empty( $value ) )
1922          {
1923              echo $params['before'];
1924              if( $type == 'double' )
1925              {
1926                  echo number_format( $value, $params['decimals'], $params['dec_point'], $params['thousands_sep']  );
1927              }
1928              else
1929              {
1930                  echo format_to_output( $value, $params['format'] );
1931              }
1932              echo $params['after'];
1933          }
1934      }
1935  
1936  
1937      /**
1938       * Display all custom fields of current Item
1939       *
1940       * @param array Params
1941       */
1942  	function custom_fields( $params = array() )
1943      {
1944          // Make sure we are not missing any param:
1945          $params = array_merge( array(
1946                  'before'       => '<table class="item_custom_fields">',
1947                  'field_format' => '<tr><th>$title$:</th><td>$value$</td></tr>', // $title$ $value$
1948                  'after'        => '</table>',
1949              ), $params );
1950  
1951          if( empty( $this->custom_fields ) )
1952          {
1953              $this->custom_fields = get_item_custom_fields();
1954          }
1955  
1956          if( count( $this->custom_fields ) == 0 )
1957          {    // No custom fields
1958              return;
1959          }
1960  
1961          $fields_exist = false;
1962  
1963          $html = $params['before'];
1964  
1965          $mask = array( '$title$', '$value$' );
1966          foreach( $this->custom_fields as $field )
1967          {
1968              $custom_field_value = $this->get_setting( 'custom_'.$field['name'] );
1969              if( !empty( $custom_field_value ) ||
1970                  ( $field['type'] == 'double' && $custom_field_value == '0' ) )
1971              { // Display only the filled field AND also numeric field with '0' value
1972                  $values = array( $field['title'], $custom_field_value );
1973                  $html .= str_replace( $mask, $values, $params['field_format'] );
1974                  $fields_exist = true;
1975              }
1976          }
1977  
1978          $html .= $params['after'];
1979  
1980          if( $fields_exist )
1981          {    // Print out if at least one field is filled for this item
1982              echo $html;
1983          }
1984      }

1993      }

1996      /**
1997       * Display more link
1998       */
1999  	function get_more_link( $params = array() )
2000      {
2001          // Make sure we are not missing any param:
2002          $params = array_merge( array(
2003                  'force_more'  => false,
2004                  'before'      => '<p class="bMore">',
2005                  'after'       => '</p>',
2006                  'link_text'   => '#',        // text to display as the more link
2007                  'anchor_text' => '#',        // text to display as the more anchor (once the more link has been clicked, # defaults to "Follow up:")
2008                  'link_to'     => 'single#anchor',    // target URL for more link, 'single' or 'single#anchor'
2009                  'disppage'    => '#',        // page number to display specific page, # for url parameter
2010                  'format'      => 'htmlbody',
2011                  'link_class'  => '', // class name of the link
2012                  'force_hide_teaser' => false, // Force an item setting 'hide_teaser'
2013              ), $params );
2014  
2015          global $more;
2016  
2017          if( ! $this->has_content_parts($params) )
2018          { // This is NOT an extended post:
2019              return '';
2020          }
2021  
2022          if( ( $more == 0 ) && ( $params[ 'link_to' ] == false ) )
2023          { // Don't display "After more" content
2024              if( !empty( $params[ 'link_text' ] ) )
2025              {
2026                  return format_to_output( $params[ 'before'].$params[ 'link_text' ].$params[ 'after'] );
2027              }
2028              return '';
2029          }
2030  
2031          $content_parts = $this->get_content_parts($params);
2032  
2033          // Init an attribute for class
2034          $class_attr = empty( $params['link_class'] ) ? '' : ' class="'.$params['link_class'].'"';
2035  
2036          if( ! $more && ! $params['force_more'] )
2037          {    // We're NOT in "more" mode:
2038              if( $params['link_text'] == '#' )
2039              { // TRANS: this is the default text for the extended post "more" link
2040                  $params['link_text'] = T_('Full story').' &raquo;';
2041                  // Dummy in order to keep previous translation in the loop:
2042                  $dummy = T_('Read more');
2043              }
2044  
2045              switch( $params['link_to'] )
2046              {
2047                  case 'single':
2048                      $params['link_to'] = $this->get_permanent_url();
2049                      break;
2050  
2051                  case 'single#anchor':
2052                      $params['link_to'] = $this->get_permanent_url().'#more'.$this->ID;
2053                      break;
2054              }
2055  
2056              return format_to_output( $params['before']
2057                          .'<a href="'.$params['link_to'].'"'.$class_attr.'>'
2058                          .$params['link_text'].'</a>'
2059                          .$params['after'], $params['format'] );
2060          }
2061          elseif( ! $params['force_hide_teaser'] && ! $this->get_setting( 'hide_teaser' ) )
2062          {    // We are in more mode and we're not hiding the teaser:
2063              // (if we're hiding the teaser we display this as a normal page ie: no anchor)
2064              if( $params['anchor_text'] == '#' )
2065              { // TRANS: this is the default text displayed once the more link has been activated
2066                  $params['anchor_text'] = '<p class="bMore">'.T_('Follow up:').'</p>';
2067              }
2068  
2069              return format_to_output( '<a id="more'.$this->ID.'" name="more'.$this->ID.'"'.$class_attr.'></a>'
2070                              .$params['anchor_text'], $params['format'] );
2071          }
2072      }
2073

2075      /**
2076       * Does the post have different content parts (teaser/extension, divided by "[teaserbreak]")?
2077       * This is also true for posts that have images with "aftermore" position.
2078       *
2079       * @access public
2080       * @return boolean
2081       */
2082  	function has_content_parts( $params )
2083      {
2084          // Make sure we are not missing any param:
2085          $params = array_merge( array(
2086                  'disppage' => '#',
2087                  'format'   => 'htmlbody',
2088              ), $params );
2089  
2090          $content_page = $this->get_content_page( $params['disppage'], $params['format'] );
2091  
2092          // Remove <code> and <pre> blocks from content to don't check [teaserbreak] there
2093          $content_page = preg_replace( '~<(code|pre)[^>]*>.*?</\1>~is', '', $content_page );
2094  
2095          return strpos( $content_page, '[teaserbreak]' ) !== false
2096              || $this->get_images( array( 'restrict_to_image_position' => 'aftermore' ) );
2097      }

2130      /**
2131       * Get array of tags.
2132       *
2133       * Load from DB if necessary, prefetching any other tags from MainList/ItemList.
2134       *
2135       * @return array
2136       */
2137      function & get_tags()
2138      {
2139          global $DB;
2140  
2141          if( ! isset( $this->tags ) )
2142          {
2143              $ItemTagsCache = & get_ItemTagsCache();
2144              if( ! isset($ItemTagsCache[$this->ID]) )
2145              {
2146                  /* Only try to fetch tags for items that are not yet in
2147                   * the cache. This will always give at least the ID of
2148                   * this Item.
2149                   */
2150                  $prefetch_item_IDs = array_diff( $this->get_prefetch_itemlist_IDs(), array_keys( $ItemTagsCache ) );
2151                  // Assume these items don't have any tags:
2152                  foreach( $prefetch_item_IDs as $item_ID )
2153                  {
2154                      $ItemTagsCache[$item_ID] = array();
2155                  }
2156  
2157                  // Now fetch the tags:
2158                  foreach( $DB->get_results('
2159                      SELECT itag_itm_ID, tag_name
2160                          FROM T_items__itemtag INNER JOIN T_items__tag ON itag_tag_ID = tag_ID
2161                       WHERE itag_itm_ID IN ('.$DB->quote($prefetch_item_IDs).')
2162                       ORDER BY tag_name', OBJECT, 'Get tags for items' ) as $row )
2163                  {
2164                      $ItemTagsCache[$row->itag_itm_ID][] = $row->tag_name;
2165                  }
2166  
2167                  //pre_dump( $ItemTagsCache );
2168              }
2169  
2170              $this->tags = $ItemTagsCache[$this->ID];
2171          }
2172  
2173          return $this->tags;
2174      }

2211      /**
2212       * Split tags by comma or semicolon
2213       *
2214       * @param string The tags, separated by comma or semicolon
2215       */
2216  	function set_tags_from_string( $tags )
2217      {
2218          if( $tags === '' )
2219          {
2220              $this->tags = array();
2221              return;
2222          }
2223          $this->tags = preg_split( '/\s*[;,]+\s*/', $tags, -1, PREG_SPLIT_NO_EMPTY );
2224          array_walk( $this->tags, create_function( '& $tag', '$tag = evo_strtolower( $tag );' ) );
2225          $this->tags = array_unique( $this->tags );
2226          // pre_dump( $this->tags );
2227      }
